page.title: 16BIRDS IN LITTONDALE
page.content: Apart from the usual common birds like finches, tits, thrushes, sparrows, and wrens, Littondale has some quite rare resident birds as well as summer and winter visitors. Among the residents are the dippers and herons, which can be seen near the river, and very occasionally the kingfisher. Equally rare residents are barn owls, though the tawny and little owl are fairly frequently seen. Spring brings goosander and oystercatcher, cuckoo, curlew, lapwing, nuthatch, treecreeper, swift and swallow. In winter flocks of fieldfares are regularly seen and sometimes the redwing. In a bad winter the ring ouzel, which usually inhabits the higher ground, comes down to the valley bottom. Seagulls, especially the black-headed gull visit the Dale.
